00000.name: Code of Honor (Soldier's)
00000.notes: An officer should be tough but fair, lead from the front, and look out for his men; an enlisted man should look out for his buddies and take care of his kit. Every soldier should be willing to fight and die for the honor of his unit, service, and country; follow orders; obey the “rules of war”; treat an honorable enemy with respect (a dishonorable enemy deserves a bullet); and wear the uniform with pride.
00000.note: An officer should be tough but fair, lead from the front, and look out for his men; an enlisted man should look out for his buddies and take care of his kit. Every soldier should be willing to fight and die for the honor of his unit, service, and country; follow orders; obey the “rules of war”; treat an honorable enemy with respect (a dishonorable enemy deserves a bullet); and wear the uniform with pride.

00001.name: Combat Reflexes
00001.notes: Never freeze; +6 on all IQ rolls to wake up or to recover from surprise or mental stun; Your side gets +1 to initiative rolls (+2 if you're the leader)
00001.note: Never freeze; +6 on all IQ rolls to wake up or to recover from surprise or mental stun; Your side gets +1 to initiative rolls (+2 if you're the leader)

00002.name: Contact (Alpha Squad (Norwegian Army))
00002.notes: [Effective skill (12); Group; Appears quite rarely (6-); Usually reliable]
00002.note: [Effective skill (12); Group; Appears quite rarely (6-); Usually reliable]

00003.name: Contact (The Club/Smuggler)
00003.notes: [Effective skill (12); Appears fairly often (9-); Usually reliable]
00003.note: [Effective skill (12); Appears fairly often (9-); Usually reliable]

00000.name: Cultural Familiarity (Norwegian)
00000.notes: Do not suffer the normal -3 penalty for unfamiliarity  [Native]
00000.note: Do not suffer the normal -3 penalty for unfamiliarity  [Native]

00009.name: Fit
00009.notes: +1 to all HT rolls to stay conscious, avoid death, resist disease, resist poison; recover FP at twice the normal rate (but not FP spent for spells or psi powers)
00009.note: +1 to all HT rolls to stay conscious, avoid death, resist disease, resist poison; recover FP at twice the normal rate (but not FP spent for spells or psi powers)

00010.name: Flashbacks (Civilian casualty)
00010.notes: In any situation that the GM feels is stressful, he will roll 3d. On a 6 or less, you have a flashback. The GM will roll whenever you miss a Fright Check or make the roll exactly, and whenever you fail a self-control roll for another stress-related disadvantage.  [Mild (Duration: 2d seconds; -2 on all skill rolls)]
00010.note: In any situation that the GM feels is stressful, he will roll 3d. On a 6 or less, you have a flashback. The GM will roll whenever you miss a Fright Check or make the roll exactly, and whenever you fail a self-control roll for another stress-related disadvantage.  [Mild (Duration: 2d seconds; -2 on all skill rolls)]

00011.name: Indecisive
00011.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever a choice confronts you, modified downward by 1 for each alternative you can see. If you fail, you do nothing.  [CR: 15 (Resist Almost All The Time)]
00011.note: Make a self-control roll whenever a choice confronts you, modified downward by 1 for each alternative you can see. If you fail, you do nothing.  [CR: 15 (Resist Almost All The Time)]

00012.name: Light Sleeper
00012.notes: Whenever you must sleep in an uncomfortable place, or whenever there is more than the slightest noise, you must make a HT roll in order to fall asleep. On a failure, you can try again after one hour, but you will suffer all the usual effects of one hour of missed sleep.
00012.note: Whenever you must sleep in an uncomfortable place, or whenever there is more than the slightest noise, you must make a HT roll in order to fall asleep. On a failure, you can try again after one hour, but you will suffer all the usual effects of one hour of missed sleep.

00014.name: Nightmares (-5)
00014.notes: Make a self-control roll each morning upon awakening. If you fail, you suffered nightmares; this costs you 1 FP that you can only recover through sleep. On a roll of 17 or 18, you are left shaking, and are at -1 to all skill and Perception rolls for the entire day.  [CR: 12 (Resist Quite Often)]
00014.note: Make a self-control roll each morning upon awakening. If you fail, you suffered nightmares; this costs you 1 FP that you can only recover through sleep. On a roll of 17 or 18, you are left shaking, and are at -1 to all skill and Perception rolls for the entire day.  [CR: 12 (Resist Quite Often)]

00000.name: Hard to Kill 2
00000.notes: +1/level to HT rolls made for survival at -HP or below, and on any HT roll where failure means instant death (due to heart failure, poison, etc.). If this bonus makes the difference between success and failure, you collapse, apparently dead (or disabled), but come to in the usual amount of time. A successful Diagnosis roll reveals the truth.
00000.note: +1/level to HT rolls made for survival at -HP or below, and on any HT roll where failure means instant death (due to heart failure, poison, etc.). If this bonus makes the difference between success and failure, you collapse, apparently dead (or disabled), but come to in the usual amount of time. A successful Diagnosis roll reveals the truth.

00001.name: Head Wound
00001.notes: Shrapnel in head. Decreased 1 IQ. Negative reaction to appearance. Loss of Max HP.
00001.note: Shrapnel in head. Decreased 1 IQ. Negative reaction to appearance. Loss of Max HP.

00002.name: Post-Combat Shakes
00002.notes: Make a self-control roll at the end of any battle. If you fail, roll 3d, add the amount by which you failed your self-control roll, and look up the result on the Fright Check Table.  [CR: 9 (Resist Fairly Often)]
00002.note: Make a self-control roll at the end of any battle. If you fail, roll 3d, add the amount by which you failed your self-control roll, and look up the result on the Fright Check Table.  [CR: 9 (Resist Fairly Often)]

00000.name: Attentive
00000.notes: +1 bonus when working on lengthy tasks, but -3 to notice any important interruption
00000.note: +1 bonus when working on lengthy tasks, but -3 to notice any important interruption

00018.name: Social Stigma (Former Norwegian Military)
00018.notes: -1 reaction to fellow military service member
00018.note: -1 reaction to fellow military service member

00019.name: The Last Gasp
00019.notes: Roll [1d6]. On a 3-6, one more action before passing out.
00019.note: Roll 1d6. On a 3-6, one more action before passing out.

traits.title: Corporal
traits.appearance: Male, Eyes: Blue, Hair: Chestnut, Skin: Light Tan

00001.name: Izhmash AKS-74U, 5.45x39mm
00001.notes: Known as a "Krinkov" in the west, it's a short carbine for service with vehicle crews and special-ops forces. Has a folding stock.

00000.notes:
Background & Experience
            1) Bodyguard
            2) Ex-Bouncer
            3) Ex-Military
            
            Gurren grew up in the slums of Norway with a single mother and 3 younger siblings.
            In order to get his family out of poverty, he quit school to do some various oddjobs in the "dark" societal area of Norway.
            
            In his childhood, Gurren smuggled contrabands/guns for the club owner, and did some various bouncer jobs i.e. collecting debts from debtors who owes money to the club owner, and throw out some troublemakers in the club.
            
            Even if he disagrees with the methods of his colleagues, he carried out their instructions diligently to the letter. 
            
            Several years later, he quit the Club to join the military. He completed his training, sent to the battlefield and attained the rank of "Corporal".
            
            Due to his "incident" in the battlefield where the orders from the higher-ups caused many civilian casualties, the trauma that he faced had caused him to become a pacifist. However, due to his nature of obedience, he still carried out his orders to the letter.
            
            He was discharged from the military due to his mental state. Soon after, he went back to civilian life and used his experience as a soldier to work as a bodyguard.

00000.name: Izhmash AKS-74U, 5.45x39mm (23 bullets)
00000.notes: Known as a "Krinkov" in the west, it's a short carbine for service with vehicle crews and special-ops forces. Has a folding stock.
